intro: Eschweilera baguensis, commonly known as the Guianan rosewood, is a tropical tree native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Lecythidaceae and is characterized by its dark, dense wood and aromatic properties. The plant has compound leaves with elongated, pointed leaflets and produces showy, red-orange flowers. It is often found in lowland and montane forest areas, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Due to its valuable timber, it is also considered an endangered species.
